programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Finding You
programme.desc: Violinist Finley Sinclair travels to an Irish coastal village to begin her semester studying abroad. At the B\u0026B run by her host family, she encounters the gregarious and persistent heartthrob movie star Beckett Rush. Romantic drama, starring Rose Reid, Katherine McNamara, Vanessa Redgrave, Jedidiah Goodacre and Judith Hoag.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: Allison is a young woman whose world falls apart when she survives an unimaginable tragedy. While in recovery for an opioid addiction and unresolved grief, she forms an unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law, Daniel, that gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together. Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: She Came To Me
programme.desc: A composer who suffers writer's block rediscovers his passion after an adventurous one-night stand. Writer/director Rebecca Miller's comedy drama, starring Peter Dinklage and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: General Leslie Groves Jr spearheads the Manhattan Project to research and develop a devastating weapon capable of ending the Second World War. J Robert Oppenheimer and his colleagues subsequently risk destroying humanity to create an atomic bomb. Christopher Nolan's Bafta and Oscar-winning biopic, starring Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt.(n)

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.(n)

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby, and his dying mother Gwen. Helen's life is a grind, but she has a chance at romance when a secret love returns. Writer/director Janis Pugh's drama, starring Louise Brealey and Annabel Scholey.(n)

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.(n)

programme.title: Finding You
programme.desc: Violinist Finley Sinclair travels to an Irish coastal village to begin her semester studying abroad. At the B\u0026B run by her host family, she encounters the gregarious and persistent heartthrob movie star Beckett Rush. Romantic drama, starring Rose Reid, Katherine McNamara, Vanessa Redgrave, Jedidiah Goodacre and Judith Hoag.(n)

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: She Came To Me
programme.desc: A composer who suffers writer's block rediscovers his passion after an adventurous one-night stand. Writer/director Rebecca Miller's comedy drama, starring Peter Dinklage and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow.(n)

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.(n)

programme.title: Dance First
programme.desc: In 1969 Stockholm, Samuel Beckett is due to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony attended by his wife Suzanne and dignitaries. As he ascends the stage to accept the honour, Beckett sparks a conversation with himself about events and people that have led him to this point. Drama, starring Gabriel Byrne and Aidan Gillen.(n)

programme.title: Life Itself
programme.desc: After falling in love at college, New Yorkers Will and Abby marry and prepare for parenthood. Meanwhile, fate links them to a group of people in Seville, Spain, including a troubled young woman. Drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Olivia Wilde and Annette Bening.(n)

programme.title: May December
programme.desc: Twenty years after their notorious tabloid romance gripped the nation, a married couple buckles under pressure when an actress arrives to do research for a film about their past. Director Todd Haynes' drama, starring Natalie Portman, Chris Tenzis and Julianne Moore.(n)

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.(n)

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Aporia
programme.desc: Since losing her husband, Sophie has juggled grief, a full-time job, and parenting her devastated daughter. However, when a former physicist reveals a covert time-bending machine, the widow is faced with a difficult choice. Writer/director Jared Moshe's sci-fi drama, starring Judy Greer and Edi Gathegi.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: In Mexico, a young woman flees to the US after her flamenco dancer mother is killed by drug cartel thugs. She crosses paths with Aidan, an ex-marine, and together they go on the run. Director Benjamin Millepied's musical reimagining of Georges Bizet's opera, starring Melissa Barrera and Paul Mescal.

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: Wallace is a medical school drop-out who has given up on love after a series of bad break-ups, while Chantry is an animator who lives with her boyfriend. The two become friends since neither is interested in a relationship with the other - but as they grow closer, they begin to wonder if they belong together. Romantic drama, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Zoe Kazan.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.

programme.title: The Survivor
programme.desc: Drama based on the story of Harry Haft, a survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp who boxed his fellow inmates to stay alive. Haunted by memories and guilt, he attempts to use high-profile fights against boxing legends like Rocky Marciano as a way to find his first love again. Directed by Barry Levinson and starring Ben Foster, John Leguizamo, Peter Sarsgaard and Danny DeVito.

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.

Director Lee Daniels' biopic based on the novel by Johann Hari, starring Andra Day, Trevante Rhodes and Natasha Lyonne.

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris O'Donnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: Neil and Alice Bennett are the core of a wealthy family on holiday in Mexico, until a distant emergency cuts their trip short. When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.

programme.title: Fanny and Alexander
programme.desc: Ingmar Bergman's Oscar-winning semi-autobiographical drama follows the lives of two children from a theatrical family in turn of the century Sweden. Their carefree lives are thrown into upheaval by the death of their father and their mother's subsequent remarriage to a puritanical minister. But refuge from their joyless new home comes in the shape of their grandmother and her lover. Starring Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Gunn Wallgren and Lena Olin.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: The United States Vs. Billie Holiday
programme.desc: The acclaimed singer is targeted by the Federal Department of Narcotics with an undercover sting operation led by Federal Agent Jimmy Fletcher, with who she had a tumultuous affair. Director Lee Daniels' biopic based on the novel by Johann Hari, starring Andra Day, Trevante Rhodes and Natasha Lyonne.(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris O'Donnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Fanny and Alexander
programme.desc: Ingmar Bergman's Oscar-winning semi-autobiographical drama follows the lives of two children from a theatrical family in turn of the century Sweden. Their carefree lives are thrown into upheaval by the death of their father and their mother's subsequent remarriage to a puritanical minister. But refuge from their joyless new home comes in the shape of their grandmother and her lover. Starring Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Gunn Wallgren and Lena Olin.(n)

Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.(n)

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.(n)

programme.title: To Olivia
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: A 19th-century missionary and his wife try to bring Christianity to the natives of the Hawaiian islands, little realising that their incursion will forever change the attitude of the indigenous population. It's not long before the couple's differing viewpoints drive a wedge between them - leading to betrayal. Historical drama, starring Max von Sydow, Julie Andrews and Richard Harris.(n)

programme.title: What Dreams May Come
programme.desc: The spirit of a man killed in a car crash uses his vivid imagination to create a breath-taking world - but he is unable to fully enjoy his heavenly home without his wife beside him. However, when grief drives her to suicide, she ends up in an altogether more hellish afterlife, prompting her husband to embark on a perilous mission to rescue her from the dark side. Fantasy, starring Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr, Annabella Sciorra and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A couple are reunited with a man they grew up with in a children's home years earlier - but the apparently happy reunion soon dredges up dark secrets from their past, and it's not long before tensions bubble to the surface. Drama, starring Cal Macaninch, Daniel Newman, Richard Mylan and Rachel Fielding.(n)

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventure, starring Zachary Levi, Lil Rel Howery, Zooey Deschanel and Benjamin Bottani.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: I'll Be Right There
programme.desc: A woman navigates the challenges of her pregnant daughter's wedding plans, her mother's health concerns and her own romantic dilemmas. Director Brendan Walsh's comedy, starring Edie Falco and Jeannie Berlin.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Meanwhile, a seasoned cowboy goes on the run with a prostitute and a young lad after killing a fellow gunman. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.(n)

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.(n)

programme.desc: Borat returns from Kazakhstan to America intent on giving his fifteen year old daughter to the vice president. programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: A man is thrown into the brutality of prison life when he gets two life sentences for a crime he claims he didn't commit. Drama starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Baron...
programme.desc: Follow Baron Munchausen's fantastical adventures as he travels around 18th-century Europe with his band of misfits. Adventure comedy.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Remakes,...
programme.desc: Kick off the new year by exploring films that are remakes, reboots or reimaginings. From The Fall Guy to The Equalizer, take a look at some classic stories through a new lens.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes
programme.desc: Ian McKellen's 93-year-old Sherlock battles his fading memory as he pieces together the details of his final case. With Laura Linney and Milo Parker.

programme.title: Eileen
programme.desc: Eileen's job at the local prison takes a twisted turn when new counsellor Anne Hathaway arrives, leading her down a sinister path. Mystery thriller.

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: When a cancer cure mutates most of the population into vicious killers, lone survivor Will Smith searches for a cure. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Sci-fi action with Jason Statham, who must come face to face with a shark as he helps a research team stuck at the bottom of the Pacific.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: While exploring the depths of the ocean, Jason Statham and his crew must evade an array of merciless predators. Nail-biting action.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' whimsical, sextuple Oscar-winning fable stars Tom Hanks as an extraordinary man who leads a charmed existence over four turbulent decades of US history.

programme.desc: A man is thrown into the brutality of prison life when he gets two life sentences for a crime he claims he didn't commit. Drama starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily's abusive relationship is shaken after her first love reappears. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Adaptation of the hit book starring Emily Blunt as an alcoholic divorcee caught up in a missing person case that sends shockwaves throughout her life.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou race across Europe in a bid to uncover a secret. Mystery thriller based on the Dan Brown novel. Violence/sex.

programme.title: The Day Of The Jackal
programme.desc: When meticulous hitman Edward Fox is hired to kill the French president, detective Michael Lonsdale faces a race against time to track him down. Violent scenes.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes

programme.title: The Danish Girl

programme.desc: The son of a Nazi officer befriends a young concentration camp inmate, learning the terrible truth about his father's work. Poignant drama. Mature themes.

programme.desc: When an NYU professor heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family... who aren't so approving of her. Hit romcom.

programme.title: Fear And Loathing In Las Vegas
programme.desc: Writer Johnny Depp and lawyer Benicio Del Toro drive to Las Vegas, fuelled by a cocktail of psychedelic drugs. Road movie based on Hunter S Thompson's novel. Mature themes.

programme.title: Hellraiser
programme.desc: A cheating wife accidentally summons the Cenobites - a group of supernatural beings - while going to great lengths to resurrect her brother-in-law. Iconic 80s horror movie.

programme.title: The Day Of The Jackal
programme.desc: When meticulous hitman Edward Fox is hired to kill the French president, detective Michael Lonsdale faces a race against time to track him down. Violent scenes.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes
programme.desc: Ian McKellen's 93-year-old Sherlock battles his fading memory as he pieces together the details of his final case. With Laura Linney and Milo Parker.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Tom Hooper's true-life drama tells the remarkable tale of transgender pioneer Lili Elbe. Eddie Redmayne stars alongside Oscar winner Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Boy In The Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: The son of a Nazi officer befriends a young concentration camp inmate, learning the terrible truth about his father's work. Poignant drama. Mature themes.

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' whimsical, sextuple Oscar-winning fable stars Tom Hanks as an extraordinary man who leads a charmed existence over four turbulent decades of US history.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Adaptation of the hit book starring Emily Blunt as an alcoholic divorcee caught up in a missing person case that sends shockwaves throughout her life.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily's abusive relationship is shaken after her first love reappears. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou race across Europe in a bid to uncover a secret. Mystery thriller based on the Dan Brown novel. Violence/sex.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: When an NYU professor heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family... who aren't so approving of her. Hit romcom.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Gritty crime drama about bootlegging brothers who fall foul of a ruthless lawman in prohibition-era Virginia. Tom Hardy and Shia LaBeouf star.

programme.title: Desperation Road
programme.desc: A mother and her child are caught in the crossfire as alcohol, guns and revenge clash. Thriller with Mel Gibson. Contains scenes of sexual violence.

programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: With an original score, Benjamin Millepied's reimagining of Prosper MÃ©rimÃ©e's 1845 novella is a dramatic modern day tale told through dance and an experimental dreamscape.

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: A hitman seeks refuge in a small village where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Sky Original film with Jessica Brown Findlay and Alessandro Borghi.

programme.title: Eileen
programme.desc: Eileen's job at the local prison takes a twisted turn when new counsellor Anne Hathaway arrives, leading her down a sinister path. Mystery thriller.

programme.desc: Amanda Seyfried and Channing Tatum star as a couple struggling to keep their romance alive when he goes to war after 9/11. Moving romance. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Gritty crime drama about bootlegging brothers who fall foul of a ruthless lawman in prohibition-era Virginia. Tom Hardy and Shia LaBeouf star.

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: Satirical comedy drama starring Jim Carrey and Ed Harris. Truman Burbank leads an idyllic life in a perfect town, but what he doesn't know is that since birth his every move has been part of an intricately orchestrated television show.

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Meg Ryan and Tom Hanks as the owners of rival New York bookshops. When Joe Fox threatens to put Kathleen Kelly out of business, he shares his misgivings about the impending closure of her store and other personal secrets with an anonymous chat-room partner - and makes a startling discovery that only adds to his dilemma.

programme.title: Hypnotic
programme.desc: Police detective Danny Rourke is haunted by the abduction of his seven-year-old daughter Minnie from a park. During a bank heist, Danny discovers a photo of his daughter with an instruction to find someone called Dell Rayne. Evidence leads to a psychic Diana Cruz, who introduces the cop to the unseen world of hypnotics - people with the ability to control how we perceive the world. Action thriller

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: This Black History Month, join us as we take a look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.

programme.title: Arcadian
programme.desc: Action horror starring Nicolas Cage. Following an apocalyptic event, single father Paul lives with his two teenage sons on an isolated homestead, forced to hide every night from the nocturnal monsters that stalk the outdoors. Though the trio has settled into a relatively stable routine, their lives are threatened when the creatures start working out how to get inside...

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Lao Luo is a washed-up stuntman with a deformed horse called Red Hare, who he saved from euthanasia. The duo become overnight sensations when a fight with debt collectors goes viral. Writer/director Larry Yang's action drama, starring Jackie Chan, Liu Haocun and Kevin Guo. In Mandarin, with subtitles.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Meg Ryan and Tom Hanks as the owners of rival New York bookshops. When Joe Fox threatens to put Kathleen Kelly out of business, he shares his misgivings about the impending closure of her store and other personal secrets with an anonymous chat-room partner - and makes a startling discovery that only adds to his dilemma.

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Comedy starring Rowan Atkinson as the accident-prone Mr Bean. In an attempt to get rid of him from his job as one of their attendants, the governors of the National Gallery send Mr Bean to America to represent them at the unveiling of the Grierson Gallery's new purchase. Needless to say disaster is never far away.

programme.title: Mr Bean's Holiday
programme.desc: Comedy starring Rowan Atkinson. Mr Bean puts the entente cordiale under considerable strain when he wins a camcorder and a trip to France in a raffle. After a typically accident-prone encounter with a Russian film director, the hapless hero ends up at the Cannes film festival.

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: Satirical comedy drama starring Jim Carrey and Ed Harris. Truman Burbank leads an idyllic life in a perfect town, but what he doesn't know is that since birth his every move has been part of an intricately orchestrated television show.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. Mesmerised by Ally's talent, Jackson invites her to perform with him and she becomes a sensation. The two begin a romantic relationship, but their happiness is threatened as an increasingly washed-up Jackson grapples with substance abuse i

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure based on the 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu, and featuring Bill Murray. When a top computer boffin is kidnapped, crime-busting trio Natalie, Dylan and Alex become involved in a game of betrayal and deception.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure sequel based on the popular 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu. When the special agents investigate a series of deaths connected to the Federal Witness Protection Programme, they discover evidence that points to "fallen" Angel Madison Lee.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine

programme.title: There's Something in the Barn
programme.desc: Festive horror comedy starring Martin Starr and Amrita Acharia. After inheriting a house in the mountains of Norway, an American family ups sticks from California and relocates. However, their decision to convert the property's old barn into an Airbnb unwittingly disturbs the creature that lives there - and hell hath no fury like an angry barn elf.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Biopic
programme.desc: When life inspires film, the most incredible stories are told. Join us as we journey through some of our favourite biopics, from Sky Original film Lee to Goodfellas and Back to Black.

programme.title: The American Society of Magical Negroes
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Justice Smith and David Alan Grier. Genial artist Aren, who is African-American, is struggling to make sense of his place in the world until he's invited to join a secret society dedicated to enhancing the lives of white people. However, Aren's debut mission tests his loyalty when he and his first assignment fall for the same person.

programme.title: Jericho Ridge
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Nikki Amuka-Bird. Injured police deputy Tabby Temple returns to work after a period of leave to discover that the station has been broken into and weaponry stolen. Her colleagues leave her to work dispatch for the night, but with a pair of local criminals still sniffing around the station, Tabby soon finds herself at the centre of a siege that steadily escalates.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: Madame Web
programme.desc: Superhero action adventure starring Dakota Johnson. While on a dangerous job, New York paramedic Cassie Webb has a near-fatal accident and develops precognitive powers. When she foresees that three young women are in danger, she sets out to protect them from the super-powered villain who wants them dead.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Horror thriller starring Emily Blunt and John Krasinski. After blind insectoid monsters with super-sensitive hearing wipe out most of humanity, a family of survivors adapts to living in silence. But with a new baby on the way, their noiseless way of life is about to become a lot more difficult...

programme.title: A Quiet Place: Day One
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror prequel starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn. New York City is suddenly attacked by terrifying alien creatures with super-sensitive hearing. Sam, a terminally ill cancer patient, and law student Eric are among those who have survived the initial assault - but how long can they remain alive when the faintest noise can be deadly?

programme.desc: Action thriller starring Nikki Amuka-Bird. Injured police deputy Tabby Temple returns to work after a period of leave to discover that the station has been broken into and weaponry stolen. programme.title: Out of Darkness
programme.desc: In the Stone Age, a gang of early humans face a mystical being hellbent on hunting them down. Prehistoric horror, starring Iola Evans and Arno LÃ¼ning. The dialogue is in a specially contructed language and features subtitles.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-April 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Night Swim
programme.desc: Forced into early retirement by a degenerative illness, former baseball player Ray Waller moves into a new house with his wife and two children. He hopes that the backyard swimming pool will be fun for the kids and provide physical therapy for himself. However, a dark secret from the home's past soon unleashes a malevolent force that drags the family into the depths of inescapable terror. Writer/d

programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. Co-writer/director Stephen Cookson's comedy, starring Diane Keaton, Hayley Mills, Patricia Hodge, Lulu

programme.title: There's Something in the Barn
programme.desc: Festive horror comedy starring Martin Starr and Amrita Acharia. After inheriting a house in the mountains of Norway, an American family ups sticks from California and relocates. However, their decision to convert the property's old barn into an Airbnb unwittingly disturbs the creature that lives there - and hell hath no fury like an angry barn elf.

programme.title: Robin and the Hoods
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Darcey Ewart and Naomie Harris. Robin is an 11-year-old girl who plays imaginative games with her friends, the Hoods, on the wooded land near to their homes. They engage in pretend battles against rival gangs, but a greater challenge emerges when a property developer, "Clipboard", threatens to transform their kingdom into a leisure facility.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: High school outcasts Janis Sarkisian and Damian Hubbard narrate the tale of 15-year-old Cady Heron, who moves back to America from Kenya with her mother. Janis encourages Cady to infiltrate the Plastics, ruled by the formidable Regina George, but when she does, the clique soon corrupts the new girl. Musical adaptation of the 2004 cult classic, starring Angourie Rice, Renee Rapp, Auli'i Cravalho, a

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: Supernatural adventure starring Paul Rudd, featuring Bill Murray and Dan Aykroyd. The spook-hunting Spengler family joins forces with the original Ghostbusters, whose work is continuing via a secret research lab. When an ancient artefact is discovered and releases an evil force, the team must work together to prevent the dawning of a new Ice Age.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Jackie Chan and Jennifer Love Hewitt. New York City limo driver Jimmy Tong finds himself thrust into the world of international espionage when he dons a hi-tech tuxedo belonging to his secret-agent boss.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

programme.desc: The delicate balancing act of making -- and safely redirecting -- casual conversation; the risks and rewards of small talk.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: Exploring the history of New York's sprawling network of overhead "protection" known as scaffolding; what it might take to reduce the nearly 300-mile eyesore overtaking the city.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: Tapping into John's "memory palace" to explore people's ability -- or inability -- to remember things.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: John has a furniture-destroying cat, so he explores the challenges of keeping an object in pristine condition.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: John explores the complex art of splitting the check.

programme.title: How to With John Wilson
programme.desc: John thanks his landlord by attempting to make the perfect risotto, which is her favorite dish.

programme.title: The Righteous Gemstones
programme.desc: Following three generations of a famous televangelist family with a tradition of charitable work, deviance and greed.

programme.title: Justice League
programme.desc: Fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Batman and his new ally Wonder Woman recruit Aquaman, Cyborg and the Flash to help them save the planet from a newly awakened enemy.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part Three
programme.desc: The Anti-Monitor attacks the remaining Earths and their inhabitants. Heroes and villains across time and space join the Justice League for a final stand against the epitome of evil.

programme.title: Justice League vs. Teen Titans
programme.desc: Robin is forced to join the young super team and soon has to help lead them in a fight against the mighty Justice League after they are possessed by the demon Trigon.

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: The Nut Job
programme.desc: A mischievous squirrel (Will Arnett) and his sidekick assemble a ragtag animal crew to get inside their town's nut shop and steal enough food for the winter.

programme.title: Rio
programme.desc: A domesticated macaw (Jesse Eisenberg) and his human friend (Leslie Mann) travel to Rio de Janeiro to meet the last surviving female (Anne Hathaway) of his kind.

programme.title: Being Mary Tyler Moore
programme.desc: Chronicling the vanguard career of Mary Tyler Moore, weaving her personal narrative with the beats of her professional accomplishments, highlighting her groundbreaking roles and the indelible impact she had on generations of women who came after her.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: A poor boy (Freddie Highmore) and four spoiled children win a tour through the incredible factory of an odd confectioner (Johnny Depp).

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) visits a nudist camp to prove a French maid (Elke Sommer) innocent of murder.

programme.title: DC League of Super-Pets
programme.desc: Krypto the Super-Dog must convince a ragtag group of animals to master their own newfound powers to help him save Superman and the rest of the Justice League.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings
programme.desc: Hobbit Frodo must melt a ring to save Middle Earth. Animated by Ralph Bakshi.

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Musical but mischievous chipmunks Alvin, Simon and Theodore wreak havoc in the life of songwriter Dave Seville (Jason Lee).

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
programme.desc: A chosen hobbit (Elijah Wood) and his loyal friends join a wizard (Ian McKellen), humans, a dwarf and an elf on a quest to destroy a powerful ring and defeat an evil lord.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.desc: Frodo (Elijah Wood) and Sam march toward Mount Doom to destroy the ring, while Gandalf (Ian McKellen) and warriors prepare for a final confrontation with Sauron and his allies.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: A sudden attack by Wulf, a ruthless Dunlending lord, forces Helm Hammerhand and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg. Finding herself in a desperate situation, Helm's daughter must lead the resistance.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: I Have Tourette's but Tourette's Doesn't Have Me
programme.desc: Children affected by the disease talk about their childhoods.

programme.title: Babe Ruth
programme.desc: Rare footage, home movies and interviews profile the legendary New York Yankee slugger.

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow
programme.desc: A 12-year-old becomes an environmental activist; the impact of warming temperatures and pollution on fish; the impact of climate change on species like the mosquito and the giant crab; readings by Tina Fey, Jeffrey Wright and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow
programme.desc: The recovery of the bald eagle from near-extinction provides a lesson on how conservation can reverse environmental damage; an environmental activism group for children spreads awareness; weather extremes; protecting newly hatched sea turtles.

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow
programme.desc: Children provide a collection of songs, activism and tips for protecting the Earth; children share their thoughts on environmental issues; scientists talk with children about how organisms are affected by a changing Earth.

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow
programme.desc: Energy use and sustainability; endangered animals; children who work to protect nature; the importance of conservation and habitat protection; readings and performances by Elizabeth Mitchell, They Might Be Giants, Dan Zanes and Willie Nelson.

programme.title: Saving My Tomorrow
programme.desc: Children and scientists discuss their thoughts on endangered species and their habitats; stories about honeybees, oysters, turtles, frogs and birds; how to protect the planet and everything on it.

programme.title: Free Birds
programme.desc: Two turkeys (Nam Do-hyung, Choi Han) travel back in time to the year 1621 to prevent all feathered friends from ever becoming holiday dinners.

programme.title: The Addams Family 2
programme.desc: Hoping to get closer as a family, Gomez, Morticia and the rest of the Addams clan embark on an adventurous road trip in a hideous and humongous camper.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel (Christopher Reeve) gets serious with Lois Lane (Margot Kidder) and fights three Krypton outcasts in league with Lex Luthor (Gene Hackman).

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Based on the play about six Southern women who become close friends despite their eccentricities and complicated lives.

programme.desc: Upon learning that their stepmother (Jessica Alba) is a retired spy, twins step up to help save the world from an evil maniac known as Timekeeper (Jeremy Piven).

programme.desc: A Latin teenager (America Ferrera) comes to terms with her self-image while helping her sister (Ingrid Oliu) work in a dress factory.

programme.title: Mass Ave
programme.desc: A racial profiling incident forever changes the relationship between a man and his son.

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death returns to claim the lives of those who did not die in a horrible highway calamity as they were meant to do.

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: A high-school senior (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) and her friends must deal with repercussions of cheating death when they survive a terrible roller-coaster accident.

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: A horrifying premonition saves a young man (Bobby Campo) and his friends from death during a racetrack accident, but terrible fates await them nonetheless.

programme.title: Final Destination 5
programme.desc: When a man's premonition saves them from a fatal bridge collapse, several unfortunate souls learn that Death will not be cheated.

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.

programme.title: The Dark Knight
programme.desc: Batman (Christian Bale) has to keep a balance between heroism and vigilantism to fight a vile criminal known as the Joker (Heath Ledger), who would plunge Gotham City into anarchy.

programme.title: Janet Planet
programme.desc: Enthralled by her own imagination, 11-year-old Lacy spends the long summer at home with her mother and three strangers.

programme.title: The Wizard of Oz
programme.desc: After a tornado whisks Kansas farm girl Dorothy (Judy Garland) to a magic land, she must travel to the Emerald City for help in getting back home.

programme.title: Flow
programme.desc: Cat is a solitary animal, but as its home is devastated by a great flood, he finds refuge on a boat populated by various species, and will have to team up with them despite their differences.

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader (Michael Keaton) saves dismal Gotham City and gorgeous Vicki Vale (Kim Basinger) from the freaky Joker (Jack Nicholson).

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: A descendant (Michael Fassbender) of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.title: Your Monster
programme.desc: A soft-spoken actress finds her voice again when she meets a terrifying but weirdly charming monster that lives in her closet.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Brian O'Conner, back working for the FBI in Los Angeles, teams up with Dominic Toretto to bring down a heroin importer by infiltrating his operation.

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Chief electronics technician Mike Williams (Mark Wahlberg) and other crew members fight for survival when the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig explodes on April 20, 2010, in the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.title: The Nun II
programme.desc: An evil spreads in 1956 France as a priest is murdered and Sister Irene once again comes face-to-face with the demonic nun Valak.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren keep a possessed doll locked up in an artifacts room in their house. When the doll awakens the room's evil spirits, it soon becomes a night of terror for the couple's young daughter and her friends.

programme.title: Woodshock
programme.desc: A haunted young woman spirals into confusion and chaos after she falls under the spell of a potent, reality-altering drug.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Jonas Taylor leads a research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. Pitted against colossal, prehistoric sharks and relentless environmental plunderers, they must outrun, outsmart and outswim their merciless predators.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: When an unmanned locomotive roars out of control, two railroad employees (Denzel Washington, Chris Pine) must find a way to bring it to a halt before it crashes and spills its toxic cargo.

programme.title: Silver Linings Playbook
programme.desc: An unexpected bond begins to form between a man (Bradley Cooper) trying to rebuild his life and a young woman (Jennifer Lawrence) promising to help him reunite with his estranged wife.

programme.title: Father Stu
programme.desc: After surviving a motorcycle accident, a former boxer and longtime agnostic starts to wonder if he can use his second chance to help others, leading to the surprising realization that he's meant to be a Catholic priest.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Hellboy (Ron Perlman) and his team face an underworld prince who plans to awaken a lethal army and use it to reclaim Earth for his magical kindred.

programme.desc: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: End of Watch
programme.desc: Two LAPD officers deal with marriage, love and fatherhood amid the harsh realities on the streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: Black Death
programme.desc: A monk investigates rumors of people being resurrected during an outbreak of the bubonic plague.

programme.title: The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren take on one of the most sensational cases of their careers when a young murder suspect claims demonic possession as his defense.

programme.title: It: Chapter Two
programme.desc: Defeated by members of the Losers' Club, the evil clown Pennywise returns 27 years later to terrorize the town of Derry, Maine. Now adults, the united Losers must conquer their deepest fears to destroy the shape-shifting Pennywise once and for all.

programme.title: My Golden Days
programme.desc: A middle-aged anthropologist (Mathieu Amalric) reminisces about family, school adventures, a student trip to the USSR and the love (Lou Roy-Lecollinet) of his life.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Victor Sullivan recruits Nathan Drake to help him recover a 500-year-old fortune. What starts out as a heist becomes a globe-trotting, white-knuckle race to reach the prize before the ruthless Santiago Moncada can get his hands on it.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: After a wild stag party in Las Vegas, three hazy groomsmen (Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis) must find their missing friend and get him back to Los Angeles in time for his wedding.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: Two male FBI agents (Shawn Wayans, Marlon Wayans) pose as female socialites to foil a kidnapping plot and save their jobs.

programme.title: The Disaster Artist
programme.desc: The incredible true story of aspiring filmmaker and Hollywood outsider Tommy Wiseau as he and his best friend defiantly pursue their dreams and embark on the hilarious odyssey of making the now-infamous, cult classic "The Room.".

programme.title: Casablanca
programme.desc: A cynical nightclub owner (Humphrey Bogart) protects an old flame (Ingrid Bergman) and her husband (Paul Henreid) from Nazis in Morocco.

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's footsteps, Rusty Griswold takes his wife and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Guided by a rebellious and charismatic coach (Hugh Jackman), British ski jumper Michael "Eddie" Edwards (Taron Egerton) trains for the 1988 Winter Olympics in Calgary, Alberta.

programme.title: You Were My First Boyfriend
programme.desc: Filmmaker Cecilia Aldarondo revisits her 1990s adolescence, a generation after she thought she'd left it all behind.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part One
programme.desc: The Anti-Monitor (the Monitor's evil counterpart) is released into the DC Multiverse and begins to destroy the different Earths that compose it. The Monitor attempts to recruit heroes from across the Multiverse to fight back.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part Two
programme.desc: An endless army of shadow demons threatens to destroy the world and all parallel Earths. The only thing opposing them is the mighty combined power of Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Green Lantern and all their fellow superheroes.

programme.title: Justice League: Crisis on Infinite Earths Part Three
programme.desc: The Anti-Monitor attacks the remaining Earths and their inhabitants. Heroes and villains across time and space join the Justice League for a final stand against the epitome of evil.

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: A king (Dominic Cooper), a mighty warrior (Travis Fimmel) and a powerful wizard (Ben Foster) unite to defend the human realm of Azeroth from a tyrannical shaman (Daniel Wu) and his invading army of orcs.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: After a serious car accident, a man (Liam Neeson) awakes to find that his wife does not recognize him, that another man has assumed his identity, and that assassins are hunting him.

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Two interstellar agents try to stop an alien disguised as a lingerie model from destroying the world.

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: Agent J goes back in time and joins forces with Agent K's younger self to save his partner, the agency and mankind's future.

programme.title: It Follows
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: Candyman: Farewell to the Flesh
programme.desc: The daughter (Kelly Rowan) of a New Orleans aristocrat ties his murder to the legend of an artist (Tony Todd) fitted with a hook.

programme.title: Amityville: Where the Echo Lives
programme.desc: A paranormal investigator must confront a terrorizing dark entity that is haunting a beloved neighbor's home.

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: Members (Emjay Anthony, Adam Scott, Toni Collette) of a dysfunctional family face the wrath of Krampus, an ancient demon from European folklore who punishes naughty children at Christmastime.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Look Into My Eyes
programme.desc: A group of New York City psychics conducts deeply intimate readings for their clients, revealing a kaleidoscope of loneliness, connection and healing.

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A lethal CIA agent (Dwayne Johnson) and his former classmate (Kevin Hart) encounter shootouts, espionage and double-crosses while trying to save the U.S. spy satellite system.

programme.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
programme.desc: Socially awkward Charlie is a wallflower watching from the sidelines, until a pair of charismatic seniors take him under their wing.

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.

programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.desc: When a vengeful trio of ancient gods arrives on Earth in search of the magic stolen from them long ago, Shazam and his allies get thrust into a battle for their superpowers, their lives, and the fate of the world.

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: In a fractured near-future America balanced on the razor's edge, a group of journalists must race through battlefields to reach the White House before D.C. falls.

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A man and his teenage daughter realize they're at the center of a dark and sinister event while watching a concert.

programme.title: The Stroll
programme.desc: The history of New York's Meatpacking District told from the perspective of transgender sex workers who lived and worked there. they recount the violence, policing, and gentrification that led to a movement for transgender rights.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: The assassination of JFK is seen through the eyes of Jackie Kennedy. The days leading up to the tragedy and the immediate aftermath are chronicled, as experienced by the First Lady, wife of the charismatic president and mother of two small children.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: The Watchers
programme.desc: A 28-year-old artist gets stranded in an expansive, untouched forest in western Ireland. Finding shelter, she unknowingly becomes trapped alongside three strangers who are stalked by mysterious creatures every night.

programme.title: Good Hair
programme.desc: Comic Chris Rock explores how hairstyles affect the self-esteem, activities and relationships of African-Americans.

programme.title: Severance
programme.desc: A killer stalks members (Danny Dyer, Laura Harris, Tim McInnerny) of a sales group from an international arms company, who have become lost in the woods during a team-building weekend.

programme.title: Another Country
programme.desc: An interracial couple try to raise their child during the racially polarizing times of 1956 Mississippi.

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: Brian O'Conner, back working for the FBI in Los Angeles, teams up with Dominic Toretto to bring down a heroin importer by infiltrating his operation.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Recovering alcoholic Charles Dederich opens a drug rehabilitation program; Synanon, as he names it, soon attracts celebrities and non-addicts who donate their time and wealth; the community grows into a movement that expands across the country.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Chuck establishes "The Synanon Religion" and maintains their tax-exempt status; Chuck becomes increasingly authoritative and dictatorial; many members find themselves weighing the benefits and costs of the choices they're forced to make.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: Chuck's behavior becomes more belligerent and abusive; he forms a military-like boot camp for delinquent children where corporal punishment abounds; TIME Magazine publishes "Swinging at Synanon" and Chuck sues for $76 million as his paranoia grows.

programme.title: The Synanon Fix: Did the Cure Become a Cult?
programme.desc: In 1977, the Los Angeles Times reports on the nine-day abduction of Frances Winn by Synanon; Chuck spends $62,000 on guns and ammunition; sentenced to five years probation, Chuck loses everything and dies in a nursing home.

programme.desc: In an alternate world, the murder of a government sponsored superhero draws his outlawed colleagues out of retirement, into a mystery that threatens their lives and the world itself.

programme.title: Camp Hell
programme.desc: Horrific events plague a teen when his parents send him to a Christian camp.

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: On Aug. 21, 1831, Baptist preacher Nat Turner (Nate Parker) leads a violent and historic rebellion to free himself and other slaves in Southampton County, Va.

programme.title: After the Bite
programme.desc: Residents and thousands of vacationers grapple with rising numbers of great white sharks off the coast of Cape Cod, Mass. Scientists investigate what has caused the surge, and what it can reveal about ocean health.
